Technique G88: Providing descriptive titles for Web pages
A prerequisite for this rule is that
Technique H25: Providing a title using the title element
is used for living up to 2.4.2 Page Titled
element describes the content of the document.

<html>
	<head>
		<title>Clementine harvesting season</title>
	</head>
	<body>
		<p>
			Clementines will be ready to harvest from late October through February.
		</p>
	</body>
</html>
elements where the first one describes the content of the document.

<html>
	<head>
		<title>Clementine harvesting season</title>
		<title>Second title is ignored</title>
	</head>
	<body>
		<p>
			Clementines will be ready to harvest from late October through February.
		</p>
	</body>
</html>
element is not placed within the
element that is the context the element can be used in
, the rule still passes, since the browser fixes it, and it doesn't cause any known accessibility issues.

<html>
	<head> </head>
	<body>
		<title>Clementine harvesting season</title>
		<p>
			Clementines will be ready to harvest from late October through February.
		</p>
	</body>
</html>
element with content present in document, and the title is descriptive of the content, even though it does not contain letters or numbers.
